name: Merdeka!
description: We have secured our freedom at last. The wretched Belanda have been pushed out and Insulindia's independence has been secured! This day will not soon be forgotten!

name: Political Crossroad
description: We stand on a political crossroad as the different groups that fought the Dutch with differing views on how the country should be ruled start to quarrel amongst each other.

name: Darul Islam takes control
description: Following the chaos of the assassination attempt, Darul Islam militants have swiftly taken over strategic points throughout the country. Power is ours now.

name: Purge the Heathens
description: In spite of the new proper regime in the country, Insulindia hosts plenty of heathens and sinners. We should focus on bringing them to the true fate, or we'll have to take action if they do not comply.

name: Establish an Islamic State
description: We should establish our state on the basis of Islamic ethical values, allowing all faithful to live their life as they always wanted: the paradise on Earth.

name: Quran Indoctrination
description: Certain sinners seem resilient against our attempts to bring them to the true faith. Even if the adults cannot be saved, we should force their children to extensively study the Quran holy script to root out heresy in the longer term.

name: Allah maha Besar
description: Allah is the greatest for He will guard the Insulindian nation from infidels and heretics.

name: Insulindian Elections
description: For a while already, calls for elections for the People's Representative Council have been happening. The current council has partially been appointed by the Dutch in the peace deal, we should give the house a democratic mandate and more importantly, lessen the Dutch influence in it.

name: Victory for Murba
description: In a surprise event, Tan Malaka's Partai Murba - Proletarian Party - has taken the majority in the DPR. Many are afraid of what will happen next but Tan Malaka, now bound to become Prime Minister has announced that he will remain within the legal framework of our government for the near future, bringing some hope to those worrying about the future of Insulindian democracy.

name: Socialise Foreign Assets
description: Foreign assets are largely owned by capitalists who don't care for the Insulindian populace but seek to earn as much money as possible on the backs of the Insulindian Proletariat. We should seize those assets to ensure its running remains ethical and good for the people.

name: Islamic Socialism
description: Tan Malaka has called multiple times for an alliance between Islam and socialism, dubbed Islamic Socialism. Through this unlikely alliance between a religion and a revolutionary spirit, western imperialism can be defeated!

name: Social Distribution
description: We need to distribute goods to every Insulindian, if we don't redistribute material wealth from the rich to the poor, many will remain stuck in such a poor disposition.

name: Negara Buruh, tani dan Pekerja
description: The PNI is corrupt and keeps the office of the Presidency on lockdown and the republican system allows reactionaries to undo all our progress. Let us commit an autocoup to establish a true worker's state!

name: Victory for Nahdlatul Ulama
description: The traditionalist Nahdlatul Ulama have come out on top in the elections and seek to maintain the democracy while introducing socially conservative laws.

name: Write a New Constitution
description: We should write a new constitution: the first one devised by the PNI is very authoritarian and seeks in the first place to keep their president powerful. The Dutch one is considered non-grata because it is Dutch. We should write an originally Insulindian and democratic constitution.

name: Split the Legislatures
description: To ensure the integrity of our democratic state, it is paramount that the legislatures are split in separate executive, legislative and judicial branches.

name: Ensure Free Speech
description: Free speech is essential in any free society. We should make sure no one feels obligated to stay silent about their political opinions, even if we don't agree with them.

name: Perwakilan Rakyat
description: We are representatives of the people first and foremost, and only rulers of the country behind that. We hope that this belief will remain in our collective consciousness for the time to come.

name: Victory for the PNI
description: Insulindians have decisively cast their vote for the only right party to rule the Insulindian archipelago, those who brought it independence: the PNI. Insulindia stands at the dawn of a new era!

name: Elevate Pancasila
description: Pancasila is the philosophical basis of the Insulindian state, standing for five principles laid out by Sukarno: belief in God, justness, Insulindian nationalism, finding mufakat by working together in sapience and having social justice for all Insulindians.

name: Guided Democracy
description: The current unguided democracy is the root cause of instability, and in turn connected to the attack on Sukarno. We should guide democracy into the right PNI way, to secure stability for all!

name: Marhaenist Unity
description: Marhaenism is the basis of our ideology: a pragmatic form of socialism emphasising national unity, culture and anti-imperialism. Let us stand together in the name of the poor farmer Marhaen and all the other Marhaens in Insulindia.

name: Merdeka atau Mati
description: Liberty or death is our creed: through the guidance of the nationalist party the country will be brought to a bright future!

name: A Coalition Government
description: No one managed to secure a decisive victory, leading to a hung dewan with the PNI taking the leading role, but with limited power as they'll have to work with other parties.

name: Shared Burden, United Effort
description: Our burden is shared, our effort united. Despite this outcome we will be able to bring the nation forward through collaboration.

name: Bhineka Tunggal Ika
description: United in division is an old Javanese motto that exactly fits our coalition government. Our beliefs may be different, but together we stand united.

name: NASASIN Compromise
description: Nasionalisme (nationalism), Agama (religion) and Sindikalisme (Syndicalism) is a concept set out by the PNI, promoting a blend of three seemingly opposing world philosophies.

name: Permusyawarahan Mufakat
description: Together we shall secure a bright future for our nation! Let us make consensus through negotiation to the point where our nation will progress forward on its own.

name: Coup of Sultans
description: We could not allow these radicals to seize power in our nation, the sultans have intervened and the dream of a monarchist Insulindia has been realised.

name: Rally the Raja's and Princes
description: We should rally the raja's and princes to partake in the rule of this nation. As the sultan is looking to expand his power, will they come to an agreement?

name: A Royal and Feudal State
description: Our state is both royal and feudal in nature: the royalty is here and strong, but a significant nobility exists throughout the archipelago. The question remains which side will come out on top...

name: Kraton Administration
description: Our nation shall be ruled from the Kraton, for the good of all Insulindians the right people shall have control.

name: Ngayogyakarta Hadiningrat
description: Yogyakartan influence is undeniable, for their sultan has secured his position as Insulindia's sultan.

name: Political Stability
description: Stability has returned as the government consolidates. With the Homefront peaceful, many wait what remains in store for our great nation in the future!

name: Establish a Foreign Office
description: Now that we secured our independent future, a foreign office should be opened to establish contacts with the outside world as we venture to further our goals!

name: Contacts with the Westerners
description: They may have colonised us earlier, but contacts with the west are still very valuable: they are technologically more advanced than many of our neighbours and their investments would be sure to improve our economy.

name: Join the Reichspakt
description: Germany and their Reichspakt imperialist framework may be somewhat off-putting to most, but they are a strong power who can protect us from those who prey upon our resources.

name: Join the Entente
description: The Entente may not be in its finest hour anymore like in the olden days, but it still exists, and has a relatively important member right besides us with whom we'd gladly stay on good terms.

name: Contacts within Asia
description: The great countries of the Asian continent are our natural allies against western imperialism and for Asian unity. We should maintain good contacts with them, perhaps we can gain protection from them.

name: Alliance with the Bharatiya Commune
description: The Bharatiya Commune was the first country to cast off colonial shackles together with its reactionary counterpart that is the Princely Federation. We should establish an alliance with them to deter the western dogs from messing with the west ever again!

name: Join the Co-Prosperity Sphere
description: Japan brings inspiration: they were Asia's rising sun who managed to become on par with the westerners; they were one of the few nations that managed to avoid the colonial onslaught, and now they seek to spread their influence throughout Asia. We should join this project against western incursion in the eastern sphere!

name: Aspirations of Malay Unity
description: There are theorists who call out in favour of a confederation between the Malay nations: Insulindia, the Philippines and Malaya-Sarawak. This theory sounds interesting, as it could result in a strong local powerbloc.

name: Malphilinsul
description: This confederation should be aptly named Malphilinsul: Malaysia, Philippines, Insulindia and refer to the joint foreign policy of these nations. Internal sovereignty would of course be preserved.

name: Confederate the Malay Archipelago
description: We should start the project with Malaysia and Insulindia as we are culturally the closest of the nations that are associated with this project, let us get Malaysia into this plan.

name: Induct the Philippines
description: No Malphilinsul project would be completed without the Philippines part of it. Let us induct them into the confederation.

name: Invite the Siamese
description: The Siamese may not always be considered part of this project, but the fact is that the Siamese are often included in the 'Malay world' concept and their proud people successfully resisted colonisation. We should invite them to join as well!

name: Malphilinsul Research Group
description: If we are to stay ahead of the many rivals of the Malphilinsul project, we should standardise our research and share our brightest mind to gain a technological edge against our rivals.

name: International Contacts
description: With our successful establishment of international contacts, surely we'll be taken a little bit more seriously on the wider world stage!

name: Insulindia's Economy
description: We should take a look at our economy; much needed to be rebuilt after the onslaught that was our struggle from independence but with our goal secured, it is time to move on!

name: Foreign Investment Market
description: We should enter the foreign investment market to further our economic growth. Currently many investors seem to see assets in our country as relatively risky investments, we should change that!

name: Invite Investors from Asia
description: We should invite investors from our Asian brethren to come and help develop our country further.

name: Reinvite Dutch Investors
description: We should restore Dutch investments to restore trust in the ability to hold assets without risk of them being seized if you are of western origin.

name: Refurbish our Infrastructure
description: Our infrastructure has deteriorated a bit since the colonial government last looked at it. Without adequate infrastructure, travelling becomes ever harder which only serves to give our country a reputation of being the middle of nowhere.

name: Expand Djakarta Dockyards
description: Djakarta's dockyards are widely acknowledged to be a beautiful sight of wooden ships shipping goods throughout the archipelago. We should modernise it however to hold modern ships to secure our future in an increasingly modern world.

name: South East Asia's Trading Hub
description: Our recent actions solidifying our economic independence while staying interconnected with the world has borne fruit, resulting in us being widely seen as a reliable trade partner and resulting in one of the fastest growth rates in South-East Asia.

name: Standing on Our Own Feet
description: We should not allow ourselves to become economically dependent on other countries. Our nation is large enough for a large degree of economic autonomy and we should make use of that advantage.

name: De Javasche Bank Act
description: By nationalising the Javasche Bank, we will have a secure central bank to effectively control our monetary policy with. While this is currently what the Javasche Bank has been doing on account of having been the central bank of the Dutch East Indies as well, but much of it was owned by Dutch private investors giving the Netherlands undue influence in our country.

name: Nationalise Dutch Assets
description: While their control over their possessions had been suspended for a while already, the time has come to officially nationalise all Dutch assets in our nation. They are only here to informally continue their colonisation after the independence anyways.

name: Combat Corruption
description: Corruption is one of the worst reasons our economy remains frozen. We should combat this tendency with all the resources we can spare!

name: Expand the Kemajoran Airfield
description: Airplanes are an important mode of travel, we should expand our airfields to make sure we can handle their quantity.

name: Found the Institut Teknologi Bandung
description: Previously known as the Technische Hogeschool van Bandoeng, the Institut Teknologi Bandung was the first technical university of Insulindia. Let us reform away from the Dutch bias that is present there and make it the primary scientific institution of our country.

name: Economic Boom
description: Our sound economic policy has resulted in an economic boom. While this does not mean all our economic problems are over, we are now significantly better off than a few years ago!

name: A New Army for Insulindia
description: If we are to secure our independence, we need an army. We have enough manpower but finding the needed guns will definitely be a challenge.

name: Guerrilla Force
description: We can't beat our enemies in head-on battle, at least not yet. A series of hit-and-run attacks from the jungle - guerrilla tactics - will be necessary to wear the enemy out so we can in turn take strategic points.

name: Inspiration from the KNIL
description: We should take inspiration from the KNIL. While their goals - maintaining Dutch tyranny over Insulindians - are despicable, we should definitely take note of their splendid organisation and discipline.

name: Picking a Doctrine for our Army
description: We should invest in researching doctrines as a guiding hand to our army in defeating our enemies, who undoubtedly invest in doctrinal advances too.

name: Artillery Corps
description: We should back our armies up with artillery, pieces of which can be strategically placed on mountains to stop our enemies in their tracks as they get barraged in the jungle.

name: Light Armour Divisions
description: Light armour is preferable to artillery: while these tanks will be hard to navigate to the jungle, they are in essence more flexible and defensible artillery. Our enemies will cower in their tents!

name: Better Guns
description: If we are to become a nation famed for its army, we should keep our infantry forces in mind too. Our guns are severely outdated, sometimes dating back to the Weltkrieg or even earlier. Time to change that!

name: Insulindia's Mountaineers
description: Insulindia is home to many mountains, volcanoes even. We should invest in special forces specifically trained to fight in alpine conditions to improve both our defence and offence.

name: Keeping our Waters Safe
description: Insulindia is a nation of islands, so long as we don't have a navy, we can hardly prevent the enemy from cutting Java and Sumatra off from the rest of the archipelago. Let us build a navy to keep the nation together!

name: Purchase Foreign Warships
description: Building a navy from scratch will be a severe challenge. We should instead try to entice foreign powers to help us build the navy we so desire.

name: Conventional Navy
description: We should build a conventional navy capable of deterring foreigners from invasion. Submarines will not do such a thing nearly as efficiently and are as such not an option.

name: Subsurface Navy
description: Let us build our navy of subsurface vessels such as submarines. In the Weltkrieg they arguably won Germany the war and our former colonial master was specialised in them as well. Let us harass their shipping to make it too expensive to attack us.

name: Yos Sudarso's Doctrine
description: Admiral Sudarso has plans for our navy. Let us execute those plans and strike fear into Insulindia's enemies!

name: An Island, a Destroyer
description: We should make sure that virtually every island has at least some kind of naval guardianship. We can hardly be taken seriously with a numerically limited navy.

name: Forming the Insulindian Air Force
description: The KNIL used to have an air force, and while only one Insulindian pilot had official training, Adusicipto has been training new Insulindian pilots. Let us take notes and establish the Indonesian Air Force to handle the war in the air.

name: Purchase Japanese Aircraft
description: Building an air force from the ground up takes time. We should try to purchase old planes from the Japanese in the name of Asian cooperation.

name: Salvage KNIL Planes
description: Several KNIL planes have been taken by Insulindian rebels, but their state is rather shabby. Let us rekindle these old planes to form the basis of our own air force.

name: Studying Air Doctrines
description: If we are to build an air force that is taken seriously in the world, we should study doctrinal advances in this sector.

name: Focus on Bombers
description: Bombers are ideal to cripple the enemy industry and infrastructure. They should make up the bulk of our nation's air force with only a small squadron of fighters to defend them on their missions.

name: Focus on Fighters
description: Without fighters, our airspace is defenceless. We should invest in fighter planes to make sure we can retain sovereignty over our air.

name: Close Air Support
description: Close Air Support is critical on the field of battle. We should invest in advancing our tactics and air force in this area.

name: Insulindian Paratroopers
description: Insulindia is wide and far outstretched. By training Insulindian airborne divisions, we can maintain a backup force that can safely be deployed on any island, even in the unfortunate event we lose naval supremacy.

name: Insulindian Marine Corps
description: Once our navy is sufficiently advanced, we could think about enlisting a Marine division, specialised in landings and cross-river warfare, with especially the former being paramount in a country with a geography such as ours.

name: A Modern Military
description: With these technical advances, we can say that our military is in a significantly better state than a few years ago. With such a capable military, Insulindia's military looks bright!

name: Inherit Design 1047
description: Wary of the Japanese, the Dutch have been working on battlecruisers of design 1047. Now that they have lost most of their influence in the Indies, they do not need it anymore, but we might! Let us gather all the information of these plans available at once!

name: Tankers into Aircraft Carriers
description: Aircraft Carriers are ridiculously expensive to build, but we have a plan: by converting a few tankers into full-blown aircraft carriers we can perhaps gain one or two. Sadly, only very few tankers are well suited for this project, so we can't continue doing this forever.
